key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA fares match in about 90% of cases, with a slight but growing undercut trend, and improved fare coverage.
Over 90% of fares are consistently lower on MSE, with minimal missing fare scenarios and stable parity rates.
Nearly 90% of published GDS fares are higher with a modest 0.4–0.5% markup, while about 1% are cheaper and 10% not found.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Around 90% of fares match the airline site across the latest week, indicating stable alignment between the OTA and direct channels.
OTA-lower fares remain below 3% overall but have steadily increased from 1.7% to 2.5% since last week.
OTA fare unavailability decreased from above 2% to about 1.3%, suggesting improving coverage on the channel.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Overall share fell from 2.1% to 1.3% over the latest month, highlighting better fare visibility.
Consistently stands near 90%, reflecting minimal price discrepancies across most itineraries.
Dipped slightly from about 6.5% to 5.5% overall, suggesting fewer instances of premium pricing on the OTA.
Grew from roughly 1.7% to 2.5%, indicating a small yet notable rise in OTA undercuts.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: SAME remained solid above 91%. OTA Lower climbed from 1.6% to 2.5%, while OTA Higher eased from 5.9% to 4.7%.
SAME hovers around 77–79%. OTA Higher shows a slight rebound to 12.3% in the latest month, while OTA Lower doubled briefly before stabilizing.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Price matches improved from 90.9% to 92.8%. OTA Higher shrank from 7.7% to 5.6%, while OTA Lower remained below 1%.
SAME stayed near 89–90%. OTA Lower rose from 3.0% to 4.7%, outpacing the slight fluctuation in OTA Higher around 5–5.3%.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Consistent price matches of about 88%. OTA Higher dropped from 7.9% to 6.5%, while OTA Lower gained from 2.0% to 3.0%.
SAME remained above 94%. OTA Higher inched up from 2.8% to 3.4%, while OTA Lower oscillated but ended higher at 1.3%.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE-lower scenario remains above 90% across all segments, confirming a consistent price advantage.
SAME scenario hovers between 6% and 10%, with marginal shifts week over week.
MSE-N/A occurs under 1%, indicating broad fare coverage; MSE-higher is not observed at all.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Less than 1% of fares are missing on MSE, decreasing slightly from prior periods and reflecting strong visibility.
Parity remains stable at roughly 6–10%. Short-haul segments show small week-over-week increases.
Over 90% of fares are consistently lower, with modest frequency declines compared to the previous periods.
No MSE-higher fares recorded, underscoring a consistently advantageous position on this channel.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: MSE-lower dominates at around 89–93%. Parity shows a small uptick from last week, while MSE-higher is absent.
MSE-lower exceeds 95%. There is a slight improvement from last week, with parity rates holding steady.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Over 96% of fares are lower on MSE. Fluctuations remain minor, and no N/A results were found.
MSE-lower averages 85–90%. SAME fares are slightly higher than DE, but still under 15% overall.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: MSE-lower fares range from 88–92%, increasing modestly from last month. SAME remains below 12%.
MSE-lower exceeds 95%, with N/A below 0.5%, reflecting robust advanced coverage on MSE.

gds_highlights.line_content: In nearly 90% of comparisons, the GDS price remained above the airline website, with an average premium of around 0.4–0.5%.
GDS listings were cheaper in about 1% of cases, offering a minor 0.15–0.2% discount vs. the airline site.
Around 10% of itineraries were not found on the channel, stable week-over-week but slightly down compared to last month.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Roughly 10% of records lacked a comparable GDS fare. Slight uptick vs. previous week (+0.16%).
Less than 1% of itineraries matched website pricing, with minimal change across all periods.
Observed only 1% of the time, delivering about a 0.2% fare savings.
Consistently around 88–91% frequency, reflecting a modest markup of 0.39–0.47% per ticket.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: GDS was higher in more than 91% of cases, averaging a 0.4% premium. The channel not found rate stood near 8%.
Above-website fares dropped to about 67%, with 28% not found, indicating fewer direct comparisons available.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: GDS higher in 93.6% of itineraries, up slightly from last month, with minimal presence of lower fares.
GDS not found frequency near 15%, while most fares (84%) exceeded the website by ~0.5%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: About 87% of fares were higher, with a slight premium around 0.4–0.5%. 0.7% offered a small discount.
Over 91% of examples saw higher GDS pricing, with nearly 2% cheaper fares. Not-found fares remained around 6%.
